| Element/Area | Threat | Likelihood (0–2) | Impact (0–2) | Detectability (0–2) | Total (0–6) | Risk Level | Preventive Measures | Monitoring Methods |
| 1. Management | HACCP Committee not functional | 0 | 2 | 1 | 3 | Medium | Security issues are tabled and actions agreed during HACCP/management meetings. | Meeting minutes are reviewed at management meetings to confirm issues were discussed and actions implemented. |
| NaN | Security awareness failure | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Security awareness is included in induction training and refresher training. Staff are instructed to report suspicious activity. | Training records reviewed to confirm completion; management observes and verifies that staff report suspicious activity. |
| NaN | Emergency preparedness gaps | 0 | 2 | 1 | 3 | Medium | Incident reporting system established. Emergency contacts available. Risk management team formally documented and in place. | Periodic review of incident reports and emergency contact lists. Management review confirms risk management team meetings and updates. |
| NaN | Recall system breakdown | 0 | 2 | 1 | 3 | Medium | Recall procedure established and communicated. Recall team in place. Relevant recall information displayed on site. Reporting structure defined. | Mock recalls conducted annually. Routine verification of recall procedure effectiveness. Management reviews outcomes to confirm effectiveness. |
| 2. Site | Perimeter breach | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Perimeter protection in place, premises fenced, controlled access at entry points. | Inspections conducted at set frequency. Reporting structure in place to escalate if risks are identified. |
| NaN | Access control failure | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Visitor reporting system at reception. Biometric facial recognition access, deactivated on termination. Staff required to report unauthorised or unidentified personnel. | Access records reviewed, biometric system updates verified. Reports of unauthorised access investigated by management. |
| NaN | Inadequate lighting (interior and exterior) | 0 | 1 | 0 | 1 | Low | Sufficient interior and exterior lighting installed throughout the site. | Lighting adequacy verified during routine GMP checks. |
| NaN | Chemicals - Unauthorised access to or misuse of chemicals (storage & use) | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Chemical store and finished product areas locked at all times. Access restricted to authorised personnel only. MSDS available on shared drive. | Regular inspections conducted to verify security of storage areas and availability of MSDS. |
| NaN | Hazardous Chemicals - Accidental or deliberate misuse/contamination with hazardous chemicals | 0 | 2 | 1 | 3 | Medium | No hazardous chemicals stored on site. Risk controlled via supplier practices and contractor management. If introduced, chemicals would be isolated, access controlled, and disposed of according to procedure. | Supplier and contractor audits verify that no hazardous chemicals are introduced. If required in future, inspections confirm isolation, access control, and disposal compliance. |
| NaN | Pesticides - Unauthorised access to or misuse of pesticides | 0 | 2 | 1 | 3 | Medium | No pesticides stored on site. Pest control managed by an external contractor in compliance with food regulations. | Service records maintained and reviewed. Contractor audited to confirm compliance with regulations and contract requirements. |
| 3. Human Element | Insider threat (employee malicious act) | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Screening and identification of employees on site. Recognition and training in food security. Control of microbiological hazards. | Monitoring of unusual health conditions and employee behaviour (potential malicious contamination). Supervisors verify training completion and monitor compliance. |
| NaN | Personal items contamination including Portable handheld equipment (site-issued mobile phones, tablets, measuring devices, etc.) – risk of physical contamination if not controlled. | 1 | 1 | 1 | 3 | Medium | Personal items restricted in facility. Medications controlled and labelled. Lockers provided for staff. Cell phones and medications restricted; hygiene procedure enforced. Mobile phones/tablets allowed only for audits or team leaders. | Regular inspections of lockers, bags, and personal items. Compliance with restrictions verified during hygiene audits. |
| NaN | Visitor/Public/ contractor access | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Valid reasons required for entry. Access restricted and verified by departmental managers for contractors. Visitors and contractors must sign in. Staff trained to report unidentified persons or suspicious behaviour. | Visitor and contractor logs checked. Department managers verify access approvals. GMP/security audits confirm adherence to visitor and contractor procedures. |
| 4.1 Operations | Raw Material & Packaging Contamination, mislabelling, or tampering of raw materials and packaging prior to or during receipt | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | All raw materials and packaging labelled and verified against delivery notes. Volumes reconciled at receipt. Off-loading supervised by forklift drivers. COA/COC required with each batch. Non-conformances managed as per documented procedure. | Integrity inspections conducted at receipt. Delivery checks against COA/COC and purchase order. Non-conformance reports reviewed during audits and management review. |
| NaN | Suppliers Approved - Use of unapproved suppliers leading to contaminated or unsafe raw materials | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Suppliers maintained on an approved supplier list. Supplier approval procedure in place with documentation retained. Deliveries only accepted from approved suppliers. | Deliveries verified against purchase orders and delivery notes. Supplier approval records reviewed during audits and management review. |
| NaN | Contamination, mislabelling, or tampering of raw materials and packaging prior to or during receipt | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | NaN | Supplier approval requires BRC/FDA certification. Vehicle inspections conducted by supplier with evidence on delivery note. Integrity inspections carried out on receipt at site. | Supplier audits and monitoring verify compliance. Delivery documentation reviewed. Integrity inspections at receipt confirm controls. Residual risk acknowledged and tracked at management review. |
| NaN | Raw Materials (External Malicious Intervention - Deliberate contamination of raw materials before arrival on site (e.g. at supplier or in transit) | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Supplier approval requires BRC/FDA certification. Vehicle inspections conducted by supplier with evidence on delivery note. Additional integrity inspections carried out on receipt at site. | Supplier audits and monitoring verify certification and compliance. Delivery documentation reviewed. Integrity inspections at receipt confirm controls. Residual risk tracked and discussed at management review. |
| 4.2 Storage, Incoming and Outgoing products (Restricted Area) | Storage – Operations & Access Control - Unauthorised or uncontrolled access to storage areas leading to contamination or damage | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Visitors and contractors allowed access only under supervision and must report to reception. Raw materials stored in separate, designated storage area. Products kept off the floor on racking/pallets with slip sheets. Service Level Agreement in place with freight company to ensure transport security. | Visitor access supervised and logged. GMP inspections verify correct storage practices. Freight company compliance reviewed through SLA performance monitoring and audits. |
| NaN | Storage – Finished Goods Malicious contamination or tampering of finished goods during storage or distribution (including intervention at packaging manufacturer) | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Finished goods packaged with virgin poly liners (no direct product contact). Vehicles inspected and sealed after loading. Full traceability procedure in place (labelling, picking slip). Transport, storage, and distribution managed under documented procedure. | Storage areas inspected during GMP audits. Product integrity verified before dispatch. Vehicle inspections and seal checks documented. Traceability procedure reviewed during audits and recall tests. |
| 4.3 Workshop | Maintenance Activities - Introduction of foreign objects or contamination during maintenance work | 1 | 1 | 1 | 3 | Medium | Maintenance carried out in a separate workshop with swarf mats and closed doors. Food-grade lubricants used. Employees trained in hygiene and maintenance procedures. “Clean as You Go” policy enforced. Personal Hygiene Standard applied. | Supervisors verify workshop segregation and use of food-grade materials. GMP audits confirm compliance with hygiene standards. Maintenance activities reviewed for adherence to “Clean as You Go” and tool control. |
| 4.4 Security of Water and Utilities | Deliberate contamination or disruption of air, water, or electricity supplies | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Access to utilities is limited and controlled. Utility points secured to prevent unauthorised interference. | Site security checks include verification of utility point security. Management oversight ensures control. Residual risk reviewed during management reviews due to high potential impact. |
| NaN | Deliberate contamination or tampering of non-municipal water supplies | 1 | 1 | 1 | 3 | Medium | Non-municipal water systems secured to prevent unauthorised access. | Regular inspections conducted. Potable water testing ensures compliance with standards. Residual risk acknowledged and reviewed at management review due to critical impact if tampering occurs. |
| 4.5 Computer-Based Systems – Critical Data Access | Critical Data Access - Unauthorised access to or manipulation of critical data systems and sensitive information | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | IT systems are password-protected with controlled access levels. Sensitive information is restricted to authorised personnel only. | Regular monitoring of system use and access logs. Residual risk remains due to potential cyber threats or internal misuse, reviewed through IT audits and management oversight. |
| 4.5 Computer-Based Systems – | Employee Exit Access Control - Former employees retaining access to critical systems or sensitive information | 0 | 2 | 1 | 3 | Medium | Access rights deactivated immediately upon resignation or termination. HR and IT coordinate to remove credentials from all systems. | Exit procedure checklist followed, with HR/IT verification. Residual risk reviewed during internal audits to ensure no active accounts remain. |
| 4.5 Computer-Based Systems – Virus Protection & Back-up | Cyberattack, virus infection, or data loss impacting product security and business continuity | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Antivirus software installed on all computers and updated automatically. Daily data back-ups implemented (local and offsite/cloud). | IT department monitors system security. Backup restoration tests conducted periodically. Residual risk reviewed due to evolving cyber threats. |
| 4.5 Computer-Based Systems – Validation Methods | Failure of IT security systems (passwords, antivirus, backups) due to inadequate validation or testing | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Validation methods in place: access control checks, system back-up verification, and antivirus updates. | Internal reviews confirm effectiveness. Periodic validation tests conducted to ensure reliability. Residual risk monitored. |
| 4.7 Neighbouring Risks – External Parties | Foreign objects (glass breakage from Novray), malicious intervention from neighbours (Pharma/Novray), pest ingress via atrium | 1 | 2 | 1 | 4 | Medium | Shatter-proofed windows installed. Glass & Brittle Plastic Register maintained. Glass Breakage Report Procedure implemented. Products covered when not in use. Doors locked and alarmed. Drains covered. Pest Control Programme documented and contractor-managed. | CCTV surveillance in place. Glass breakage reports logged and reviewed. Pest control contractor service records checked. Routine inspections confirm window, drain, and door integrity. |
| 5. Product Defence Plan | Failure to implement monitoring & NCA | 0 | 2 | 1 | 3 | Medium | NCA process embedded into management system with defined responsibilities. Procedures in place for GMP audits, CCTV reviews, and recall testing. | GMP audits conducted routinely. CCTV footage reviewed periodically. Mock recalls performed and reviewed. NCA outcomes tracked through management review meetings. |
